docs.text: Quantum Hydrodynamics This is a video of what happens to a droplet of silicon oil when it is placed on a vertically vibrating bath. It bounces up and down on the surface of the liquid bath rather than coalescing with the liquid. Why? Let's find out!
docs.title: Home

docs.text: This is a video of what happens to a droplet of silicon oil when it is placed on a vertically vibrating bath. It bounces up and down on the surface of the liquid bath rather than coalescing with the liquid. Why? Let's find out!
docs.title: Quantum Hydrodynamics

docs.text: Air Layer To understand this phenomenon, we need to consider the air layer between the droplet and the liquid bath. Typically, when a droplet falls onto the liquid bath, the air between the droplet and the liquid bath.
